intro: Gagea lutea subsp. burnatii, commonly known as the Burnat's yellow star, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, grass-like leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces small, spherical bulbs that are adapted to survive in harsh, alpine environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
